definition: a saw/to cut with a saw

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: It was you that broke the new wood.
sentences.chinese: 是你鋸開了那塊新木頭。

sentences.english: If it's a lumber yard, take in the smell of sawn wood.
sentences.chinese: 如果是一個木材場，吸入鋸開的木頭的味道。

sentences.english: He asked me to saw the wood for him.
sentences.chinese: 他叫我替他把這塊木頭鋸開。

sentences.english: As the district attorney paced, the men cut through the first layer of metal. Nothing.
sentences.chinese: 地方檢查官踱着步子，警員們鋸開第一層金屬板。

sentences.english: One quality of pinewood is that it can be sawn easily.
sentences.chinese: 松木的一個特點是容易鋸開。

sentences.english: One quality of this kind of timber is that it can be sawn easily.
sentences.chinese: 這種木料的一個特點是容易鋸開。

sentences.english: A transverse fracture was produced at the middle of the patella.
sentences.chinese: 於髕骨縱向中點橫形鋸開，造成橫形骨折。

sentences.english: When a saw cuts easily through a piece of wood, the wood is in tension.
sentences.chinese: 在用鋸毫不費力地鋸開一塊木頭時，木頭是受拉的。

sentences.english: Before it is sawn, it is left to dry in the sawmill.
sentences.chinese: 在原木被切鋸開之前，是被放在鋸木場裏面晾乾。
